Universal access to education would lead to a more informed and knowledgeable society, which could potentially lead to better decision-making and problem-solving skills.
It would also help to break down socio-economic barriers and provide equal opportunities for individuals from all backgrounds to succeed.
Education could become more standardized and efficient, leading to a reduction in the time and resources required to complete tasks.
There could be an increase in innovation and creativity as individuals have more access to the knowledge and skills needed to pursue their passions.
There could be a decrease in crime rates as individuals have more opportunities to learn and grow, and are less likely to turn to criminal activities as a means of survival.
